alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington and east central Penobscot Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1130 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Springfield, or 10 miles east of Lincoln, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Danforth, Springfield, Topsfield, Licoln Township, Lee, Mattawamkeag, Winn, Burlington, Prentiss, Kingman, Carroll, Drew Plantation and Brookton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
